required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Trial to Assess Three Different Doses of OPS-2071 in Patients With Bacterial Enteritis

brief_summary.textblock: To assess safety, efficacy and pharmacokinetics of multiple dosesin patients with Bacterial Enteritis caused by Clostridium difficile infection(CDI) or Enteric infection.

primary_outcome.measure: Bacterial Elimination Rate (BER) in the CDI and EI Groups
primary_outcome.time_frame: CDI group: screening, Day 4 and Day 11 (end of treatment), EI group: screening, Day 4 and Day 8 (end of treatment)
primary_outcome.description: Judged according to the assessment criteria for the bacterial strain isolated as the causative pathogen based on the data from the microbiological examination. Analysis was performed by disease group and by dose, and by minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) values of OPS-2071 for each of the causative strains (Enterotoxigenic E. coli, Enteroaggregative E. coli, Campylobacter sp., C. jejuni, S. aureus, K. oxytoca, and C. perfringens for the EI group). Data were shown as all strains total. Concerning microbiological outcome by causative strain, bacteria elimination rate (BER) and its 95% confidence interval (CI) were calculated. The BER was the proportion of causative strains assessed as either "Excellent" or "Good" except for those assessed as "unknown/indeterminate".

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of OPS-2071 on Day 4
primary_outcome.description: We measured OPS-2071 concentration in plasma and evaluated Cmax of OPS-2071 in plasma.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of OPS-2071 on Day 4
primary_outcome.description: We measured OPS-2071 concentration in plasma and evaluated tmax of OPS-2071 in plasma.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Recurrence Rate of CDI After Multiple Doses of OPS-2071 (for CDI Group Only)
secondary_outcome.description: CDI recurrence rate at follow-up (Day 38) or withdrawal was calculated. CDI recurrence rate was the proportion of the subjects judged as "recurrent" against evaluable subjects, except for those with missing data.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Time to Resolution of Diarrhea After Multiple Doses of OPS-2071
secondary_outcome.time_frame: CDI group: Day 4, Day 11 (end of treatment) and Day 38, EI group: Day 4 and Day 8 (end of treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: The time from the start of dosing until the first formed stool (except in cases where liquid or unformed stools recurred) was evaluated as time to resolution of diarrhea. If formed stool has not been observed, then the subject will be handled as missing data.

secondary_outcome.measure: Stool Frequency Per Day After Multiple Doses of OPS-2071
secondary_outcome.time_frame: CDI group: screening, Day 4, Day 11 (end of treatment) and Day 38, EI group: screening, Day 4 and Day 8 (end of treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Under each disease group, the improvement of clinical symptoms (stool frequency/day) were assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Formed Stool, Liquid or Unformed Stool, and Bloody Stool After Multiple Doses of OPS-2071
secondary_outcome.time_frame: CDI group: screening, Day 4, Day 11 (end of treatment) and Day 38, EI group: screening, Day 4 and Day 8 (end of treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Under each disease group, the improvement of clinical symptoms ((i.e. formed stool, liquid or unformed stool [3 and more times], and presence of bloody stool) were assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Abdominal Pain, Nausea, and Vomiting After Multiple Doses of OPS-2071
secondary_outcome.time_frame: CDI group: screening, Day 4, Day 11 (end of treatment) and Day 38, EI group: screening, Day 4 and Day 8 (end of treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Under each disease group, he improvement of clinical symptoms (i.e. presence of abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting) were assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Response Rate (CRR) in the CDI and EI Groups
secondary_outcome.time_frame: CDI group: Day 4 and Day 11 (end of treatment), EI group: Day 4 and Day 8 (end of treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: The CRR and 95% CI at each evaluation time point were calculated. The CRR was calculated as the proportion of the subjects judged as "clinical cure" or "clinical improvement" against evaluable subjects, except for those with missing data.

arm_group.description: OPS-2071 50 mg/day：25 mg tablet administered orally twice daily
OPS-2071 100 mg/day：50 mg tablet administered orally twice daily
OPS-2071 200 mg/day：100 mg tablet administered orally twice daily
OPS-2071 400 mg/day：100 mg two tablets administered orally twice daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The patient provides written, informed consent before the clinical trial is initiated
- The patient has distinctive symptoms and findings of bacterial enteritis
- The patient has bacterial enteritis with one or more of the following causative pathogens either proven or presumed: C. difficile, Salmonella, Campylobacter, pathogenic E. coli, and other bacteria estimated to cause bacterial enteritis
- The patient and his/her partner are willing to take contraceptive measures from initiation of investigational medicinal products (IMPs) to 4 weeks after administration of IMPs
Exclusion Criteria:
- The patient has severe or progressive underlying disease or complication, making it difficult to ensure safety in the study or proper efficacy assessment
- The patient has a current diagnosis or history of convulsive disorders, such as convulsion and epilepsy
- The patient has a severe hepatic dysfunction
- The patient has a severe cardiac dysfunction
- The patient has cardiac arrhythmia or congenital or sporadic long QTc syndrome. Or the patient is treated with a drug reported to prolong QTc interval
- The patient has a moderate or severe renal dysfunction
- Women with confirmed or suspected pregnancy or breast-feeding women
- Patients judged to be ineligible by the investigator for any other reasons

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This trial was performed as a global trial in Japan, Republic of Korea, and Singapore.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Subjects with bacterial enteritis were divided into 2 groups, a Clostridium difficile infection (CDI) group for subjects with bacterial enteritis associated with C. difficile infection and an enteric infection (EI) group for subjects with bacterial enteritis for which the causative pathogen was Salmonella, Campylobacter, or pathogenic E. coli. Only one dosage (100 mg) of OPS-2071 was administered to CDI subjects and 3 dosages (100, 50, and 200 mg) were administered to EI subjects.

group.title: CDI Group
group.description: OPS-2071 was orally administered at a dose of 100 mg twice daily in the morning and evening for 10 days.

group.title: EI Group (50 mg)
group.description: OPS-2071 was orally administered at a dose of 25 mg twice daily in the morning and evening for 7 days. The administration was started with the 100 mg group, and the safety and efficacy during the treatment period were to be assessed by the Data Review Committee. If the 100 mg group had no safety concerns and the efficacy was assessed "effective," 10 subjects each who were not in the 100 mg group were to be randomized to the 200 mg or 50 mg group, and the 2 groups were to be treated in parallel. If the 100 mg group had no safety concerns and the efficacy was assessed "not effective," 10 subjects who were not in the 100 mg group were to be allocated to the 200 mg group as the next step.

group.title: EI Group (100 mg)
group.description: OPS-2071 was orally administered at a dose of 50 mg twice daily in the morning and evening for 7 days. The administration was started with the 100 mg group, and the safety and efficacy during the treatment period were to be assessed by the Data Review Committee. If the 100 mg group had no safety concerns and the efficacy was assessed "effective," 10 subjects each who were not in the 100 mg group were to be randomized to the 200 mg or 50 mg group, and the 2 groups were to be treated in parallel. If the 100 mg group had no safety concerns and the efficacy was assessed "not effective," 10 subjects who were not in the 100 mg group were to be allocated to the 200 mg group as the next step.

group.title: EI Group (200 mg)
group.description: OPS-2071 was orally administered at a dose of 100 mg twice daily in the morning and evening for 7 days. The administration was started with the 100 mg group, and the safety and efficacy during the treatment period were to be assessed by the Data Review Committee. If the 100 mg group had no safety concerns and the efficacy was assessed "effective," 10 subjects each who were not in the 100 mg group were to be randomized to the 200 mg or 50 mg group, and the 2 groups were to be treated in parallel. If the 100 mg group had no safety concerns and the efficacy was assessed "not effective," 10 subjects who were not in the 100 mg group were to be allocated to the 200 mg group as the next step.

baseline.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): all subjects who had received the investigational medicinal product (IMP) at least once and from whom data on at least one efficacy endpoint had been obtained after the start of IMP administration.

group.title: CDI Group
group.description: OPS-2071 was orally administered at a dose of 100 mg twice daily in the morning and evening for 10 days.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Bacterial Elimination Rate (BER) in the CDI and EI Groups
outcome.description: Judged according to the assessment criteria for the bacterial strain isolated as the causative pathogen based on the data from the microbiological examination. Analysis was performed by disease group and by dose, and by minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) values of OPS-2071 for each of the causative strains (Enterotoxigenic E. coli, Enteroaggregative E. coli, Campylobacter sp., C. jejuni, S. aureus, K. oxytoca, and C. perfringens for the EI group). Data were shown as all strains total. Concerning microbiological outcome by causative strain, bacteria elimination rate (BER) and its 95% confidence interval (CI) were calculated. The BER was the proportion of causative strains assessed as either "Excellent" or "Good" except for those assessed as "unknown/indeterminate".
outcome.time_frame: CDI group: screening, Day 4 and Day 11 (end of treatment), EI group: screening, Day 4 and Day 8 (end of treatment)
outcome.population: Microbiological per Protocol Set (MPPS) comprised those subjects in the FAS for whom the causative pathogen was identified and for whom microbiological outcome was assessed as "Excellent", "Good", or "Poor" , excluding subjects for whom microbiological outcome was assessed as "unknown/indeterminate".

group.title: CDI Group
group.description: OPS-2071 was orally administered at a dose of 100 mg twice daily in the morning and evening for 10 days.

If the 100 mg group had no safety concerns and the efficacy was assessed "effective," 10 subjects each who were not in the 100 mg group were to be randomized to the 200 mg or 50 mg group, and the 2 groups were to be treated in parallel. If the 100 mg group had no safety concerns and the efficacy was assessed "not effective," 10 subjects who were not in the 100 mg group were to be allocated to the 200 mg group as the next step.

outcome.title: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of OPS-2071 on Day 4
outcome.description: We measured OPS-2071 concentration in plasma and evaluated Cmax of OPS-2071 in plasma.
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetics Analysis Set (PKS) comprised subjects in whom plasma drug concentration had been measured at least once.

measure.title: Time to Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of OPS-2071 on Day 4
measure.description: We measured OPS-2071 concentration in plasma and evaluated tmax of OPS-2071 in plasma.

outcome.title: The Recurrence Rate of CDI After Multiple Doses of OPS-2071 (for CDI Group Only)
outcome.description: CDI recurrence rate at follow-up (Day 38) or withdrawal was calculated. CDI recurrence rate was the proportion of the subjects judged as "recurrent" against evaluable subjects, except for those with missing data.
outcome.population: Clinical per protocol set (CPPS) comprised those subjects in the FAS for whom all scheduled examinations at all specified observation time points up until end of treatment or withdrawal had been performed. Analysis was performed by dose in the proportion of subjects judged as "clinical cure" at end of treatment (EOT) in the CPPS.

group.title: CDI Group

Analysis was performed by dose in the proportion of subjects judged as "clinical cure" at end of treatment (EOT) in the CPPS.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Formed Stool, Liquid or Unformed Stool, and Bloody Stool After Multiple Doses of OPS-2071
measure.description: Under each disease group, the improvement of clinical symptoms ((i.e. formed stool, liquid or unformed stool [3 and more times], and presence of bloody stool) were assessed.
measure.population: CPPS comprised those subjects in the FAS for whom all scheduled examinations at all specified observation time points up until end of treatment or withdrawal had been performed.

class.title: Liquid or unformed stool at Screening
Liquid or unformed stool on Day 4
Liquid or unformed stool on Day 8
Liquid or unformed stool on Day 11
Liquid or unformed stool on Day 38

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Abdominal Pain, Nausea, and Vomiting After Multiple Doses of OPS-2071
outcome.description: Under each disease group, he improvement of clinical symptoms (i.e. presence of abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting) were assessed.
outcome.time_frame: CDI group: screening, Day 4, Day 11 (end of treatment) and Day 38, EI group: screening, Day 4 and Day 8 (end of treatment)
outcome.population: CPPS comprised those subjects in the FAS for whom all scheduled examinations at all specified observation time points up until end of treatment or withdrawal had been performed.

group.title: CDI Group
group.description: OPS-2071 was orally administered at a dose of 100 mg twice daily in the morning and evening for 10 days.

group.title: EI Group (50 mg)
group.description: OPS-2071 was orally administered at a dose of 25 mg twice daily in the morning and evening for 7 days. The administration was started with the 100 mg group, and the safety and efficacy during the treatment period were to be assessed by the Data Review Committee. If the 100 mg group had no safety concerns and the efficacy was assessed "effective," 10 subjects each who were not in the 100 mg group were to be randomized to the 200 mg or 50 mg group, and the 2 groups were to be treated in parallel. If the 100 mg group had no safety concerns and the efficacy was assessed "not effective," 10 subjects who were not in the 100 mg group were to be allocated to the 200 mg group as the next step.

group.title: EI Group (100 mg)
group.description: OPS-2071 was orally administered at a dose of 50 mg twice daily in the morning and evening for 7 days. The administration was started with the 100 mg group, and the safety and efficacy during the treatment period were to be assessed by the Data Review Committee. If the 100 mg group had no safety concerns and the efficacy was assessed "effective," 10 subjects each who were not in the 100 mg group were to be randomized to the 200 mg or 50 mg group, and the 2 groups were to be treated in parallel. If the 100 mg group had no safety concerns and the efficacy was assessed "not effective," 10 subjects who were not in the 100 mg group were to be allocated to the 200 mg group as the next step.

If the 100 mg group had no safety concerns and the efficacy was assessed "effective," 10 subjects each who were not in the 100 mg group were to be randomized to the 200 mg or 50 mg group, and the 2 groups were to be treated in parallel. If the 100 mg group had no safety concerns and the efficacy was assessed "not effective," 10 subjects who were not in the 100 mg group were to be allocated to the 200 mg group as the next step.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Abdominal Pain, Nausea, and Vomiting After Multiple Doses of OPS-2071
measure.description: Under each disease group, he improvement of clinical symptoms (i.e. presence of abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting) were assessed.
measure.population: CPPS comprised those subjects in the FAS for whom all scheduled examinations at all specified observation time points up until end of treatment or withdrawal had been performed.

outcome.title: Clinical Response Rate (CRR) in the CDI and EI Groups
outcome.description: The CRR and 95% CI at each evaluation time point were calculated. The CRR was calculated as the proportion of the subjects judged as "clinical cure" or "clinical improvement" against evaluable subjects, except for those with missing data.
outcome.time_frame: CDI group: Day 4 and Day 11 (end of treatment), EI group: Day 4 and Day 8 (end of treatment)
outcome.population: CPPS comprised those subjects in the FAS for whom all scheduled examinations at all specified observation time points up until end of treatment or withdrawal had been performed.

reported_events.time_frame: From the start day of IMP administration up to Day 38
reported_events.desc: Adverse events (AEs) occurring after IMP administration were included in assessment of AEs. All subjects receiving at least 1 dose of IMP were included in the safety set.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
